text: Great place to eat and hang out whether it's day or night!  Service is awesome and it has a drive thru too!  They have a great breakfast burrito with a tummy green salsa. The patio has been updated recently so night time dining or happy hour is great. Highly recommend this local spot!

So, we're moving into the community and thought we'd check out the local restaurants. 32 Shea was one of the first. Started with breakfast, awesome and very attentive baristas. Then moved to dinner, amazing! Really, the food is amazing and better yet, the staff is awesome. Every evening is a surprise with the entree of the moment but one thing for sure, you won't be disappointed. If you like Perfect Manhattans, Josh makes them "Perfect". Try this restaurant out, you will not be disappointed.

I have been to 32 Shea for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and the occasional coffee pick me up. The food has always been great. The one time there was a problem and I sent back my breakfast sandwich, it was remade quickly and correctly and delivered with an apology. The staff is typically chatty and friendly. I think I have tried most of their bruschettas and they have all been excellent. Salads are good sized, fresh, and delicious. The atmosphere is pleasant and fun. Overall I just enjoy everything about 32 Shea.

I live down the street and never stopped in until today.  I'm still enjoying my Nutella Mocha, and decided it was necessary to contribute to the great reviews!

I'm very impressed with the menu they have for drinks and food for such a small establishment.  I got the New Mexico Burrito and was definitely not disappointed.  I also think the prices are extremely reasonable considering the great quality I experienced.  I've worked as a barista for a chain, and this local spot puts the coffee/espresso drinks I've made to shame!

Stopped in at 32 Shea for some lunch.  The people were friendly . Had the tuna sandwich with green apple  which was quite bland. I really wanted to like this place and may give it another try. The neighborhood needs more unique places like this.

Been here twice so far. Enjoyed two different coffee drinks that were well made and an ok breakfast burrito. The patio has a wonderful atmosphere (that is also dog friendly!). The staff are friendly and welcoming. Great neighborhood vibe.

I was introduced to this place by my girlfriend. Its awesome. Great food, fun, laid back atmosphere and good prices. What more do you need? This place feels like a boardwalk cafe in San Diego. Succulents on the tables, big safari windows, and the nutella mocha is to die for.  Highly recommended for a Sunday brunch.

Love this place - my favorite neighborhood restaurant/bar/coffee--I would have given 5 stars, except it needs to be BIGGER!  Love the food - always fresh.  Cocktails are inventive - even the tea is great!  Still my favorite neighborhood place-- great cocktails and food!  Love the staff and the food!  Brought 8 people here for a luncheon and although small they accommodated us perfectly on the shaded patio.

I had high hopes for this place - nearby, cute patio, dog-friendly...it had great potential!  But, sadly, they are not accommodating to vegans.  At all.  We went for happy hour and found out that even the hummus had animal products in it.  (yuck)  I asked the server if maybe he could check with the chef to see if there was anything they could do for us. But the server (who was actually very nice) came back with a resounding "No."  Wow.  It has been a while since I've visited a restaurant that would not make ANY effort to accommodate a vegan diet.  Lucky for me, there are plenty of other great bars/restaurants that will happily give me something delicious to eat!

Every time I come back home to AZ to visit family I stop in at least twice for breakfast and it's amazing every single time. This trip I think I'm up to four visits - not mad about it.

Maybe it's a glaring lack of breakfast burritos on the East Coast that makes me crave the New Mexico burrito, but honestly I think it's the delicious salsa that gets me so hyped.

The coffee is fantastic, the tea is delish, and the atmosphere is a wonderful retreat from the craziness of Shea that lies just beyond the patio.

While you wait for your drinks on a busy morning, watch the well-choreographed dance that takes place at their espresso bar; it's awesome to watch so many great drinks made and the teamwork of the staff shine through in such a small workspace.

Cheers and hats off to the staff and owners of 32 Shea - keep up the great stuff and I can't wait for my next trip home.

We have been coming here for a while now and we love it every time. Paul is the best and makes the best mimosas! We always get a mimosa and beer when we come. When we wake up early enough, we always get the new mexico burrito with bacon added. The green sauce that come with it is amazing! During lunch, we will get the chicken raspberry salad or the stacked turkey with bacon added. It's a cozy place and they always have fun music playing. I come here hungover to get mimosas and one time I even ordered just a beer with a plate of bacon. The staff is always friendly and go out of their way to make whatever you want!

I live right around the corner from here. I've driven by many times but never stopped. I saw 32 Shea featured on FOX 10 AM this morning. The food looked so good I had to try it. I ordered the English Muffin Breakfast Sandwich. It was one of the best Breakfast Sandwiches I have ever eaten. It is also a cute and comfy place to sit and eat have coffee or drinks. I would totally go there again and again.

Very small, but wonderful food and wine. Some of the staff mentioned that they worked previously at Bomberos Cafe & Wine Bar (now Timo's Wine Bar).

The concept of this place is killer.

Hipster joint .....some decent craft beers in a bottle and the pricing is decent on happy hour. I haven't been all that impressed with the food. However, one of the few decent spots in the area so they are always busy.

Three years ago, I checked out the new 32 Shea (named for the corner I've lived near my whole life!), and said I appreciated their presence. Well, three years later, I still do! I stopped in today for a late breakfast and coffee. During the day, I like to do work here-they have outlets and I can sit by the windows overlooking their patio, which gives the illusion of a garden, not a big old intersection!

I ordered the New Mexico Burrito, which was superb! Especially the green salsa on the side. I am also a big fan of their caramel macchiatos.

At night, I am enticed by all their happy hour deals. There's $20 for a bottle of wine and bruschetta night, and burger and shake night. They keep me informed of these deals on their pretty food photog Instagram page! 

There's also an added summer bonus: it's nice and cool inside at 32 Shea. Something about the indie music, iced beverages, and dark walls. Whether I'm here after a YouFit workout or I've just burned my hand on my car door, stepping into 32 Shea always cools me down. So thanks, 32 Shea. I'm glad you're in the hood.

We always have incredible food and great service here!  Restaurant week was no different - it was excellent.  So good, in fact, I went back a second time.  The first time, I had the Gorgonzola stuffed dates and the Nutella mole braised short ribs on marscapone risotto.  They were both superb.  Very rich and flavorful!  I asked the owner to add the dates to the regular menu!  The ribs were cooked to perfection.  I was stuffed before dessert even came out.  There was a mistake and they brought the Affagado instead of the cheesecake.  Best mistake ever!  I didn't do the drink pairing only because the grapefruit martini (BEST cocktail in town) was not part of the pairing.  I had to be rolled out I was so full (and I'm not a petite guy).

I went back two nights later and had the same dishes because they were so good! Except this time I had the cheesecake, which was great.  

I'm always amazed at what they are able to produce in this little place given how tiny their kitchen is.  The small neighborhood feel and ambiance tops it off.  

Overall, the best restaurant week experience I had this year (and we went out every night)!!!

The drinks were pretty good; I had the dirty chai. The service, was the worst I've ever received. 

I felt extremely unwelcome and it took 10 minutes to make a couple drinks. During that time, the two people working behind the counter never looked at us and took their sweet time making the drinks. 

We considered leaving several times. 

I will not be going back.
Neighborhood gem! I love this place for breakfast, delicious coffee and burritos! Great secluded patio for those cooler days!

The customer service at 32 Shea has been consistently awful over the past few years. It's disappointing because I really enjoy their food! I typically go through the drive-thru and I always sit there for a few minutes while the three or four staff members who can clearly see me just completely ignore me. The times I've tried to get their attention were a waste. It's interesting how most of their staff has the exact same attitude. Really really weird.

I live a mere mile from 32 Shea, and pass it at least twice a day, every day. I remember when the building was a little coffee shop. Never had a reason to stop in until my gal-friend, who lives on the west side(!), suggested we meet there for dinner. Now... I hang my head in shame. I should have been the one saying "Oh, you have to try 32 Shea. It's amazing!" Well, I am now a fan and we plan on going monthly. This will give me the opportunity to try EVERYTHING. 

This visit I had the Roast Beef Sliders. I can't express to you how melt-in-your-mouth moist the beef was, and the wee buns were incredibly soft (I'm sure it's an artisan bread and not just a "bun"). And the horseradish spread was delish! We didn't partake in any leaded beverages, but they have a pretty nice selection.

I think the most amazing part of this experience is... you forget you are seated just yards from 32 St. Not an overwhelmingly busy stretch of road, but it does have its fair share of traffic. No matter to me! The strategically placed trees, music and staff divert distract and engage successfully!

The only reason i took off a star is its size, especially indoors. Very "quaint." The outdoor patio is a great location, though, when the weather is kind. 

Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves and look forward to returning.

A long overdue update to say that they actually DO have great $5 glasses of wine for happy hour. They just had different shift staff working the night that I went. Still a cute and casual place for a nice HH chat. I'm a fan.

One of my favorite spots in Phoenix! The food is delicious and the staff is always friendly. It's one of those spots where the staff learns your name overtime and you feel like an insider. My favorite brunch dishes are the New Mexico burrito and the Early Bird sandwich. Don't miss the Nutella strawberry muffins! For dinner I like the Turkey Sliders and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. Favorite drinks are the vanilla latte (hot or iced) and the tropical green tea.
This place was a good find!! Great friendly service and awesome espresso martinis!! Small and quaint with a cool patio!

I visited 32 Shea tonight for some takeout and was pleasantly surprised. The staff was engaging, funny and answered all my questions. I thought it was a good balance of helpfulness without kissing my ass. The food was fantastic (I smashed those sliders) and I'm looking forward to my next visit. Looks like a great atmosphere for a date night away from the kids.
Cute neighborhood spot. Love the patio! Pet friendly. Great go to for any meal of the day, but especially brunch and happy hour. Friendly staff.
Been my spot for time now. The vibe is chill with a little bitchiness, but I like it. Lmao. The food is good, staff is genuinely nice and I keep going back.

Thank you for nutella mochas!!!  You changed my life and I think about them all the time.  Had the OMG too and OMG!! I love you for making that too.  It was amazing and so was the chopped salad.  I wish we had more local places like this to enjoy.  We will keep coming back.

The food was good and staff was friendly. The only downside is there isn't enough seating and it is a little pricey. The place gets very busy and we actually had to wait for a table even after we got our food lol. But it was worth the wait and we enjoyed the patio seating, beautifully decorated and comfortable.

Visiting Phoenix from Richmond, VA, found this place on Yelp, and was thoroughly impressed.  The weather was mid seventies so it made for very peasant ambiance with all the windows open.  I ordered a cortado espresso drink and it was great.  Me and my wife got the lox bagel and omg sand which based on previous review recommendations.  This place was nothing short of fantastic! You will not be disappointed.

Just wanted to give these people props for opening a bad ass coffee shop in Central North Phoenix! We met business partners here for a meeting recently and they were just as impressed as we were with the layout of the shop and the coolness of the design! Not only is it a cool place to hang, but they had some wonderful drink mixes and small bites to eat! It was the first time I have ever tried Nutella with coffee "Mocha w/Nutella". It was SO good I had 2! The staff was very friendly as well! I will definitely be back to visit soon!

This was my first time here, I went through the drive throw. I asked for a New Mexico burrito with no bacon since I'm vegetarian. I got home and opened my burrito to find bacon and no avocado. I was kinda upset, yet took off the bacon and ate the burrito anyways. It was a good burrito yet I was just disappointed the order was wrong.

32 Shea CATERING: I used 32 Shea to cater an outstanding Breakfast Burrito brunch  for Nurse's week for approximately 45 staff members.  The famous New Mexico Burritos got rave reviews and disappeared in a flash. 32 Shea is locally owned and operated and the owner was so accommodating and efficient that she came in extra early to assemble our order and had it available on time and even earlier than the 6:30 AM pick up requested. The house made  Green Salsa had just enough kick to complement the delicious bite size  egg, potato, cheese, avocado and bacon (optional) burrito platter. They also provided me with their exceptional Coffee- to- Go in a large ready to pour travel container. Next time I will add the outstanding Nutella Mocha Coffee, my personal fav.  32 Shea is a little oasis in the middle of a shopping center with easy parking and access, a lovely patio, and a drive through for those on the go. The owner and staff of 32 Shea are flexible, efficient, exhibit a total "can do" attitude, and radiate positivity. The quality of the food and the service cannot be beat for local, fresh, and delicious. They aim to please. I would not hesitate to use them again for all my catering needs for brunches, lunches, or meetings.

Great neighborhood spot. I am a semi-regular for dinner (including last week for Restaurant Week) and I'm always knocked out by Chef T's creativity. Her nightly specials are so good I don't even ask what they are anymore. I just hope there's some left when I get there. The place has a laid back vibe. You can dress or wear a shorts.

ok OMG, First no one came to wait on us for 20 minutes! Then I asked about Happy Hour drinks, a house Vodka Martine was $9 at 4pm on a Saturday at a Coffee House in a Parking Lot at 32nd Street and Shea!!! THEY HAVE A DRIVE THRU FOR GOD SAKES!!! we got up and left and went to the Chinese Restaurant in the same complex 
Little Peking, great food great Plum Wine and no BS! I wonder what the "House Vodka Martine is when it's not "HAPPY HOUR" !!! Talk about over RATED!!! Do not step foot in this DIVE!!!

Try the muddled blueberry vokda drink!! We went in around 3:30pm on a Saturday and had a wonderful experience. I was so glad there was room for three of us since it's too hot to sit outside now. Our food tasted amazing and our server(they don't usually start serving tables until 4pm) was SUPER friendly. We will definitely be back again..maybe on a Saturday night, just because her service was so amazing!

Wow, lunch here with friends as we are from Illinois!!!  Had the roast beef sandwich with tea it was GREAT!  We dined outside in the courtyard area, Today it was "perfect" for dining outside!!!  Will for sure point  this spot out to our Son and his family!!!

Let me start by saying this spot has a lovely, tree-lined outside patio and delicious food. So why the low rating? Service. We have family who live nearby and visit several times a year, so when we first discovered this place nearly three years ago, everything was fantastic. We felt lucky to find such a great spot. During the last year, year and a half, though, the service has gotten slower and slower and slower. About a year and a half ago, it took 1.5 hours for us to get two glasses of wine, some turkey burger sliders and a mac and cheese. So we didn't go back for a few months. Then we tried it again because as I've said, we love the location, atmosphere, libations and food. This time it was a two-hour wait for simple dishes on a weeknight. So we waited a few more months and went back and, again, a two-hour wait. After a few more months, we tried it again on a recent Wednesday around 6 p.m. and after half an hour of waiting for a server, we left. As we were pulling our car out of the lot, we saw the couple that had been sitting next to us that had sat down a few minutes after we did also walking to their car. 

I would be much more forgiving if this were a one-time problem due to unexpectedly large amounts of diners and not enough servers. But this half an hour (at least) wait to get a server to your table and two-hour long dining experience is nothing new. 

To Management: You've got a gem of a restaurant here. All you need to do is hire an extra wait person or two and this problem will be fixed. Unfortunately, you've lost us as there are lots of other great places nearby. I hope you don't lose even more customers.

My husband and I went out last night to try Aioli Burger at their new brick and mortar location, but when we arrived we could see a big line. Wondering to do about dinner, we turned around and spotted 32 Shea and figured, hey, why not? We are so glad we did! We started off with three kinds of bruschetta, which were nicely balanced in terms of what you get in each bite. One was caprese, one was apples, brie and honey, and one was salami (and I don't remember what else). For dinner I got the lobster mac and cheese and my husband got the braised ribs. The mac and cheese is crazy! So much rich gooey cheese and nice chunks of lobster, incredibly luxe comfort food. The braised ribs melt in your mouth (yeah, I tried 'em, I'm not crazy!) they are so tender and perfect. My husband does not really like polenta at all, which is what came with the braised ribs, but 32 Shea has turned him into a believer and he polished his plate. We were too stuffed for dessert sadly, but you better believe we'll be back. Very friendly staff, showed up at the right moment without being too intrusive.

My only comment for the restaurant is that we were going to sit outside but the seats are pretty hard (just metal). I'd love to see them move into a bigger space somehow!

If you're never been to 32 Shea, you're missing out. Not only is the mocha the best I've ever had, their tropical green tea is to die for. Seriously. 

Anything you order is sure to leave you wanting more. Try to chopped salad or stacked turkey for a sure win. Having moved away from Phoenix, each time I returned I make sure to visit multiple times to get my fix of 32 Shea. Its the very best.

Really cool little urban coffee beer and wine spot! This part of town is cool but neglected and I'm grateful 32 Shea arrived! The food is tasty, but watch out for the ton of garlic salt they like to use in everything!
This place is so cool. Food Awesome ,service Awesome , ambiance . This is a must try.

I come to Phoenix to visit a few times a year and this is my favorite stop for morning coffee. Their service is relatively quick and the quality if the drinks is great. It's the perfect stop after a long morning hike in the summer heat. 

Definitely give the lavender latte a try!

Great lite fare.  Sandwiches, soups, and salads.  My personal favorite is the OMG (a sandwich with prosciutto,  marscapon, and figs.  We've tried several of the sandwich and been very happy with all of them.  

They have a full espresso bar and it the drinks are very good.  I used to own a coffee house, so I'm picky about my espresso.

Service has always been friendly to us and our two dogs who usually accompany us.  We have a Doberman that has excellent restaurant manners and a whippet puppy who has well puppy manners.  

If you come for dinner ask to be seated.  Yes even on the patio and despite the fact you didn't see the sign.  If you don't prepare to be scolded.  Keep perspective and smile.  They are just doing their best to keep everyone happy.  

I really enjoy this place and drop in whenever I'm in the area, which always seems to be with my dogs.

The americano is the best in town.  
A must try is the new Mexico burrito with no cheese and extra avacodo.
The staff is knowledgable and friendly. 
This place rocks for coffee and they have free wifi...
Always great service.  Love calling in my beverage order and using the drive thru. My favorite is the iced lavender white mocha. Sounds weird but it's worth trying for sure.

Awesome place to hangout! Breakfast yummy in my tummy sandwich is my favorite.  Servers are the right mix of friendly & efficient. Cool to offer coffee in morning and then alcohol in evening. Wish I lived within walking distance to make it my local place.  Drive-thru too!

Great coffee until today.  My iced vanilla latte didn't taste like the usual, it tasted as though it was just soy milk.   I called later to order another one and rather than just apologizing and giving me a new one, the drive-thru employee had to point out the color of the coffee vs. soy milk in another cup.  Then he proceeded to tell me I should be ordering more than 2 shots of espresso.  I don't think so!  It's the same coffee I order every single time. I'm supportive of small business', however, this will be my last visit. 

The owner for some reason has always been rude to me and her rudeness escalates when the café is busy.  I've tried to look past it all since the café does serve a good latte.   I stopped in one day to inquire about a gift certificate for our school auction in return for FREE advertising to over 300 people.  A simple kind "no" would have been sufficient.

I love this little neighborhood cafe/wine bar.  Great HH for wine & beer although the selection is limited.  What they do carry is delicious.  The menu is small, but fresh, tasty and very reasonably priced. The bruschetta might be the best in town (sorry Postino's). The dingy strip mall surrounding the restaurant is a real eyesore, but they do an admirable job of creating your own little oasis in the cement.  They are pet friendly which makes it great for a Sunday morning bike ride with the pooch (the bloody Mary will knock you off your seat).  Be prepared to sweat. It is REALLY warm inside during the summer months.  The patio is cozy, covered & there is a mist system, but being surrounded by a huge mass of concrete diminishes the cooling effects.  Although the interior is cramped, everyone is friendly and the barkeep will remember your favorite drink and dish and the owners are often your neighbor on the bar stools. There are very few neighborhood watering holes or coffee shops around here and I am so happy for this spot. I would recommend it to anyone!
Awesome drinks food and especially awesome lady in the morning never forgets to remind me about the punch card.  And they have a drive through.
Great place for coffee! They offer both soy and almond milk and have a wide range of syrups. The drive through moves pretty quick but it can get a little backed up on a Friday.

12 hour happy hour rocks! Their Nutella coffees and new mexico burritos and awesome. Come back for lunch and have their cobb salad and soup of the day. Their 4 to 6 munchies are amazing the bruchettas are perfect with a variety of $5.00 glasses of wine. Dinners of the night are for people who really love  good food. The patio is perfect this time.of year. Also their free WiFi is icing on the cake!!

This is one of my favorite cafes in AZ. The setup is so calming and secluded you forget that you are in the heat. I come here almost every weekend for breakfast and have a Nutella coffee and their New Mexico. Every time I come it meets my expectations and leaves me very satisfied!

If you go to the place and spend hundreds of $$$ over the course of a couple years......don't expect more the $5 off your second bottle on Tuesday.........even if the online ad doesn't mention that....
And if  you complain.......you will be thrown out and police called.
Pathetic

Very. Rude. Owner.
Enough said.

Stopped here today to get a quick lunch. This is not the place to go for a quick meal or for good customer service! However, the food was delicious and worth the wait. The BLT had lots of crispy bacon and the bread was crunchy and had great flavor. The patio is adorable and very comfortable.

Cool, hip little coffeehouse. The Nutella Mocha is a must. My parents were not sure what to think when we walked in but they ended up loving it. Nice ambiance inside with candles and a relaxing looking outside seating. I also got the hummus and vegetables but ran out of vegetables with over half of the hummus left ha.

I have been going here since they opened and everyone who works there is great and its always nice to talk to everyone both the employees and customers. The coffee and food are great, I have had coffee all over North America and this definitely ranks high for me.

I'm a little confused about all the 5 star reviews. I've been in a few times and used the drive thru a few others. Coffee is good, a little better than sbux. The idea is great, the feel is great. The execution... leaves something to be desired. 

I don't even get why they have the drive thru. They don't have a speaker to give your order. So basically you have to pull up to the window to get your order in. This creates huge problems if there are a few cars in front of you. I've spent over 20 minutes in this drive thru or waiting off to the side while they prepare the food or drink. 

The delay wouldn't be an issue if I were inside relaxing, but if speed isn't going to be a priority, then just skip the drive thru all together. 

Long story short, visit this place over sbux as long as time isn't an issue.

We love this little neighborhood cafe.  They have created an oasis in the middle of a parking lot of an aged shopping center.  We enjoy riding our bikes here with the family.  They have yummy salads and sandwiches and a great happy hour.  $5 bloody Mary's and mimosas all weekend
My girlfriend, my husband and I have eaten there three times lately. Gourmet food, great prices and a huge surprise inside what I thought was just a coffee place. So much more

If I could give them a negative star I would. Because everytime i have been there it has been just that: NEGATIVE. This place is an absolute joke! Their attitude of pretentiousness and judgement is extremely hurtul. Get off your highhorse Rebecca and PC staff.  You shouldn't be treating people like u do. There is something seriously wrong with your way of thinking! Get over yourself.

If you are a parent going to Imagination Avenue, which is the same shopping center, stopping here is a must.  They have a drive thru with all the same kinds of things you can get at any good coffee house.  Then after your kids are worn out from playing, you can go back to get lunch.  My turkey sandwich was so good.  The staff was very friendly.

Customer service much ? No. None. The atmosphere was alright. The latte was alright. The   lukewarm sandwich and day old unflavored tomatoes on my salad were gross, but not as gross as their customer service. Upon walking in, we stood at the counter to order and look at the menu board, we were handed a menu and asked to sit down to review it, leading me to believe this would be more of a semi-full service restaurant. We ordered food and drink and went out to the patio. No one told us that our drinks would be ready at the counter. After a while a waitress brought out our food and we asked about our drinks. She simply said "yeah, they are inside. You can get them at the bar." Who does that ??? Who says that ? Bring our drinks to us or explain that upon ordering. The staff was incompetent and the food sub par. Coffee was ok, but I wonder what my toxic plastic intake is due to the fact that they have their exposed cup storage sitting in a patio outdoors. Nope nope nope. I will be recommending that no one ever go there. This was my second attempt at this venue (not even worthy to be called a restaurant). Disappointed. Disappointing. Disrespectful. Dissatisfied.

These guys rocked Restaurant Week.  I attended a few but here...The food was amazing!  Had the artichoke dip, amazing!  Then the Nutella braised short ribs...omg to die for!  Espresso dessert was the perfect finish to all of this.  And if the food was not enough, the drink pairing was a perfect match and all unbelievable!  You smashed it 32 Shea!
The food, coffee and drinks here are bomb, the employees however were somewhat rude.  Try the breakfast buritto and a mimosa! They are dog friendly, if you bring your pup they have a water station!

I got the turkey cranberry sandwich and mint lemon drop martini- both very yummy!!! Everyone we were with liked the food they got. Cute place but very small! We had 5 adults and 2 babies so we needed to sit outside and rearrange the tables to fit but it wasn't too bad since it wasn't that busy.

I LOVE this place! All the staff are friendly and know my name and drink. They also have great food and strong drinks for dinner, and a convenient drive thru until the afternoon. Support local and check out this place.

I LOVE 32 Shea. I would recommend their lavender white mocha and the O.M.G sandwich. The only reason I think twice about coming here is because I have a young daughter and the place isn't super kid friendly. Sometimes I don't feel super welcome coming in with a child, but the staff is great and I love that they have a drive through for breakfast and lunch! The atmosphere is incredible though so I would recommend eating at the restaurant.

My husband and I had been here several times and enjoyed both the food and the ambiance. However, our experience on Saturday night April 8 was horrible.  We brought our son, daughter, son-in-law, and grandbaby, and expected a pleasant, outdoor dining experience.  Instead, the service was incredibly slow, the food mediocre, and the manager failed to properly address legitimate concerns.  We arrived at 7:30 pm and didn't leave until 10pm,  because the service was so slow.   We repeatedly asked for our food.  It arrived 1 1/2 hours after we ordered!   By the time we got our food, we were all so tired and starving, we couldn't even enjoy it. When we told the manager about the delay, she accused us of being wrong about the time, and tried to blame the poor waitress, telling us she would call over the server and let her explain that she had somehow failed to tell us the kitchen was slow that night.  It was a terrible way to handle customer service and not fair to the server.   The manager  gave us a free desert and 20% off the tab.  But we would have rather had good food, served on time.  We will not return.

Nice, laid back place. Nutella mocha is pretty good, perfectly sweet without being too much. Place is a bit small and cramped inside, it's also really dark... not a good place to come and do some reading/studying at night. Good service and nice wait staff.

Thirty-Touche'!!!

The Mint Lemondrop Martini is THE BEST martini in town!  A little frothy, not too sweet, great flavor and it packs a punch!  I come here often for happy hour and wish there were a few bar type munchies on the menu to go with the great drinks.  So, instead I get a sandwich and I'm good for the evening - love the turkey with cranberries.  The toasted cibatta bread gives crunch and texture.

I'm glad this is my 'hood. Looking forward to when everything else nearby updates to this standard.  They also have events to promote community, look for the mommy and me, dog days, etc.  

Love patronizing our local indy businesses who work this hard to make a dream come true!

Great patio atmosphere! Carissa the server who single handedly runs the patio is AMAZING!!! She connects with her customers, which is rare these days to find. She is the reason why my family and I will be coming back here on a regular basis. Thank you again Carissa for making Shea 32 our new Friday night restaurant!

Love this place!!! They have a DriveThru!!! With two kids under 3- this is a HUGE and amazing deal to get quality coffee and food without getting everyone out. I wish they didn't close their DT after 4PM- I would happily stop going elsewhere for evening caffeine/meals.

How disappointing my last visit here, and it was entirely attributed to the staff. These two girls (new since my last visit there) work there who have no concept of waiting on people, let alone running a business. They seemed more interested in chatting with their friends hanging out there then servicing customers. I sat there for ten minutes and neither of them bothered to even acknowledge me. What a shame that the good food and drink and nice ambience of the place has been ruined by an incompetent staff. It was like the place has been taken over by high schoolers. Too many other wine bars are out there that provide consistent customer service for me to bother returning to this place ever again.

I miss living so close to here. This place is amazing. I love how it's the perfect coffee and breakfast shop in the morning. A great place for a lunch or a pick me up drink. And by evening and night time it's the perfect place to gather with friends or a date and have a drink or two. 

Josh is great. He knows his stuff and is just awesome. Honestly everyone I have encountered for the most part is really cool and efficient. The owner is great too and always remembers Brian and I. We would bring my boyfriends cousins dog with us all the time to 32 Shea when we would dog sit. They have water bowls and treats for dogs. It's a great atmosphere and I miss living so close to here! Will be back soon :)
This place is wonderful. Good menu. Short but good. Drinks galore. Great girls.

A friend and I went here the other day, coffee for me and a late lunch for her. I got the caramel macchiato with whole milk. The service was fast and friendly. My drink came out with an adorable heart drawn on the top in foam. The drink was warm and filling without being overly sweet. My friend got a tuna salad sandwich with chips, and she said it tasted very good, with an unexpected but pleasant addition of some crunchy apple in the tuna salad. The place is very small on the inside (maybe 8 tables that can seat 2 people each? I didn't count exactly, but somewhere around there), but there's a lot of seating out on the patio. Even though it's tiny, it's feels cool and comfortable without being over-the-top hipster. The patio was a pleasant seating place. Even though 32 Shea is at a fairly busy intersection, the green shrubs surrounding the patio lent a feeling of privacy and intimacy. There was a cute little dog watering station with signs welcoming pets on the patio area, so it's a good place to go if you're a dog person. I want to come back some time and try the food myself... maybe in the spring when the weather will be perfect for sitting outside.

Simple dishes but great fresh flavor and impressive options for this hip spot. Jaymee's personality was as sparkling as a Cullen in sunlight (Team Edward 4life). Thanks for the tasty caprice salad and Nutella mocha! :D Perfect chillaxin outdoor seating too.

I have given this place two chances now. It has a great feel and is close to my home so I was hoping that it would be my new place for business and friend meetings. It has a bistro feel to it but doesn't want to be a friendly, hang out, bistro type of place. The staff is inattentive and rude. The food is decent but nothing special and I have to pay full price for an iced tea each time I want a refill. I try not to be cheap but that's $2.25 each time I fill up with plain old green tea. Perhaps the last straw was sitting in the patio area and watching the owner ask two people who had settled in with their two beautiful and well behaved dogs to move from a table with four chairs to a table with two when the place was nowhere near full. Then watching as she moved the umbrella that was shading our table back to another table almost knocking people and drinks over in the process.  This could be a great place but it needs a major attitude adjustment.

Unbelievable! This tiny place in an otherwise overlook-able parking lot is a diamond in the rough. It's hip, clean, fun, and versatile. 

Need some coffee in the morning to kick start the day? Coffee is great here and they make it quickly. 

Need a lunchtime meeting place? Indoor and outdoor seating and a good menu give you options.

Going on a date? With food, wine, and a full drink selection you are covered. And the cute modern ambiance does nothing but help facilitate an enjoyable evening. 

Tiny and fantastic and worth a visit. Or two. Or three...

Love it.  We've been going regularly since they opened.  I switch between the coffee and the nutella mocha.  Both are great.  Food's good.  The staff are very friendly and welcoming.  Can't wait till they start serving beer and wine.

The tomatoes on my open-faced pesto grilled cheese sandwich tasted like... tomatoes, actually! At least the ones I remember from when I was a kid. Was not expecting something so simple to taste so good and fresh! I was by myself-- and don't usually like dining alone, but as soon as I entered the door, the bartender, Josh, made me feel right at home. Later on, the owner came over and chatted with customers for a while-- which was so nice! 

The atmosphere is welcoming and hip, with a romantic feel (great date setting), and the food fantastic.
My only complaint is that it is so far from Fountain Hills. The fact that I'll be back, with friends, despite the drive, says a lot. I'm trying the Happy Hour, next time!

My review is in two parts....first the food and service,  I came here solely on the write up in the North Central Phoenix News which gave this place very favorable reviews, especially the Mint Lemon Drop Martini.  I am a HUGE lemon drop fan so that is what made me make the short drive up the 51 to find this cute little bistro.  Its an adorable little place with a great dog friendly patio and cozy inside space.  I took a seat at the bar but quickly moved outside because it was just too warm.  The bartender was charming and very informative and made me my Mint Lemon Drop which was just as tasty as I was hoping it would be.  

I wasn't that hungry but wanted to nosh on something so I had the Lahvosh of the day which was a bacon avocado.  The portion was plenty and the lahvosh was still crispy when it came to me and not soggy.  I ate every piece.  My only negative comment would be on the outside space....I sat at the outside bar and it was very uncomfortable.  The barstools don't have backs to them and the bar top is a little too high for comfort.  Also there was a lot of bird droppings on the bar top and it needs to be repainted.  The tables and chairs on the patio are metal and there are no cushions for the chairs which look like they would be very uncomfortable.  The ambience of the place is charming though and like I said, the food, drink and staff were just fine.  I will definitely go again but will probably ask for a table inside.  Cheers!

A perfect place to meet clients for a coffee or grab a light breakfast. It's always my go-to place to relax in the morning when I have a day off. I'm so happy that this place has had such success- the result can often mean a significant wait time and trouble finding a place to sit however. I went once for dinner and wasn't really impressed with the meals- definitely more of a wine bar vibe at night with light appetizers. Great staff, great coffee and breakfast food!
This place is awesome! The new Mexico burrito is to die for. The atmosphere is laid back and cool. The employees are super friendly will come back!!!

Visited tue evening. All inside tables full. Very warm inside. Sat at the bar. Food was a little slow coming, no big deal. Enjoyed our drinks. Roast beef sliders are great. Chicken chop salad was big and very good. Recommend this place highly.

We were not as impressed as other people. I did like the patio but the only open table did not have an umbrella. I asked for one since it was hot and sunny and was told the one for that table is broken and they don't have any more. We brought our two dogs to the dog friendly patio and when we asked for a bowl of water for the dogs we were told there is a charge of 25 cents! How horrible is that to have a dog friendly patio and not even give them water! We were ordering two meals and two beverages so we were put off by that charge of 25 cents. Also, they just give you a paper bowl and you have to fill the water yourself. The sandwich comes with chips and if you want the soup upgrade it cost $2 extra. When the food came out we couldn't believe how tiny that soup is. Don't bother spending the extra $2. You have to clear your own dirty dishes and trash. The place just does not seem like it is run that well. Our sandwiches were mediocre and small portions. No pickle on the side of the sandwich and no garnish. It said sandwiches come on a "toasted ciabatta" which neither of ours were toasted and I would call it more of a hamburger bun rather than a ciabatta. I don't see what the hype is about and we both agreed we wouldn't bother going back.

Feels intimate and friendly-like I found my neighborhood's pulse-point.  I love the improvements on the patio, casual atmosphere and creative pairings.  Specials are delightful escapes from ordinary, but their ordinary is delicious!

Meh. If you want to skip the details, there are plenty of better places. It's more dog friendly on the patio than kid friendly because of the service. Came here for restaurant week and it was lopsided. For instance, for service we would give it a 2 to 2.5 star rating. The concept of the food we would give a 4 or 4.5 rating. Execution of that concept was 2-3 stars. The frustrating thing is with a little training of the wait staff, and a little more tasting of the food before it goes out of the kitchen and we would agree with the 4 stars. 2 starts feels a little harsh but the yelp "Meh. I've experienced better" was exactly how we felt.

First the food: We have the salmon salad and gorgonzola dates to begin with. The salmon was a hair salty, but that was nothing to be too worked up about. The bacon wrapped gorgonzola dates appetizer was the highlight of the evening. On to the main course. We had the nutella mole short ribs and lobster mac and cheese. The first three bites of the mac and cheese were delicious- But then... after a few more bites the richness of the plate began to weigh in, and left us wanting  some kind of vegetable, or color, or something to break up the monotony of an otherwise good dish. Lobster mac can be found in a lot of places, and this just seemed like a lazy attempt at it. Nutella mole short ribs-- The risotto that accompanied was very rich, which made the mole all the more heavy because of its richness. Nutella mole was very sweet and would have been better pared with some kind of spice-- some habanero or something to counter the sweetness. Finally the desert course. K had the mascarpone cheesecake and I had the espresso mousse. The espresso mouse was very good and well done. I'm a coffee drinker and did not think the espresso was overpowering. The cheesecake... we walked away thinking that it was store bought and not made from scratch. Still good, but not great.

Now for the service. We elected to sit on the patio with our baby since the patio is very well done and inviting. We walk past two employees, and although I am carrying a car seat and a 20 pound child, offer no help as where the front door is. Ok, no prob, that's our fault I suppose. You have to be smart enough to get inside a restaurant. We are quickly seated because we are certainly on the early side of the dinner crowd at 5:30pm. With a sleeping baby and a setting Phoenix sun, we are thankful to be sat at a 4 top table (one chair for the baby and 30 things that must accompany a baby). And then we wait. 20 minutes later the server tells us that her "boss would kill her" if she kept two people at 4 top table. So wait... the manager would rather we wake a sleeping baby, move the diaper bag, car seat, bottle bag, and another bag so that you can seat us at a two top??? A quick glance around the patio and we see two ladies seated at a 4 top. The patio at this time is half full. We know when we are being lied to, and our first reaction was 1) ok, we will leave and then 2) bring you manager here so they can tell us directly. We went along with it, our fault, because it being a Saturday, we were afraid that our date night would be pizza at home. Here's a tip for service industry people that don't have kids: when you see a couple out, and they have a child/children: their night out is a big deal. It takes work to get your family out into the world and that couple is probably trying to make their night out special. If they get that special night out, the chances of a better tip and/or good word of mouth about the place go through the roof. Add more challenge to that night out and you get 2 stars. 

We knew the price going in, but after two glasses of wine (they didn't give us the happy hour price but we didn't know if that was restaurant week so I didn't say anything) and a Moscow mule (bartender forgot to shake it so it tasted REALLY strong at first) $110 after tip. No way that was worth it.

Who doesn't like a small hands on family business and in my case the best place to go for my craving for Pinapple /coconut muffins; among others fresh from the oven!  Although I'm not there every day even; with my  visits they know my first name and what coffee fix and muffin I crave.       Its nice to see smiling faces in the a.m.

I took my very touchy, food nut girlfriend there for lunch and she loved the sandwich, score!!! one!!! as she is hard to please. Mine was very fresh, tasty and the service was great.  This is a busy place, it is small with a limited menu but that menu has very good items on it.  Like home made food! 

Being from small town Iowa (Go Boji) I want that warm family feel that 32 Shea gives me; along with smiles, great food and conversations with people that feel the same. 
So if you like the small town warm feeling, great food and banana bread, muffins and Great coffee drinks served with smiles for a smiley a.m. Always great people to chat with from all walks of life.

Make 32 Shea your stop, support small business with Great coffee, food and yummy muffins and banana bread!!  Plus if you sit and drink coffee you will probably be talking to some very well known people without a clue to who they are.

Great little spot! I'm usually there for breakfast and it's great but I've recently fallen in love with their lunch menu. 

Coffee is great. New Mexico burrito is great. And the lunch Turkey Stack is wonderful!

I'd recommend this for a fast bite or a nice casual meal!

Love this place - especially their outdoor patio. It is a great spot where you feel like you're in a zen garden... When you're really near a big street! 

The owners clearly spent considerable time, energy and money in decorating the whole place! Everywhere you look a thoughtful detail can be spotted. For the mindful amongst you, it's a meditative experience to roam the premises with your eyes, finding visual treats amongst the leaves, tables and windows.

As a not-coffee-snob-simpleton who prefers either an Americano or espresso free of sweeteners or creams, I enjoy the coffee here. I can't speak to drip coffee, lattes or other souped up espresso drinks, but they are available for those who enjoy some flavor and variety. 

32 Shea isn't limited to just caffeination... You can fill your belly too! I've had two sandwiches here and was pleased with both - the roast beef and turkey. It's nice that it's only $1 to upgrade to a salad from chips!

Finally, the staff is very friendly, and after only 3 visits recognize me. I find that welcoming atmosphere to be a huge plus if I'm frequenting a locale!

Great place, great food, coffee and mimosas!  Too bad the drama queen making coffee drove off no less than 4 people in the short time I was there.  If a busy morning of making coffee is enough to ruin your life maybe consider another career.  Major attitude from this guy makes the aumbiance uncomfortable to say the least.  I witnessed one lady ask if "he was having a bad day or if he was an a$$hole all the time!"  Yikes.  If you want a good coffee and a great breakfast burrito with a side of major attitude this is your spot!

I've been here twice, but plan to come back a few more times before I decide if there are enough pros to overcome the horrific management. They have HH 6am-6pm and a "Munchie Hour" 4pm-6pm. The HH includes $6 mixed drinks, $5 wine, and $4 beer/cider. The Munchie Hour menu includes a list of 8 $3 bruschetta and $5 dips or a caprese salad. The employees who work here are pretty fantastic so no complaints there.

The first time I came here I got the Stacked Turkey sandwich with a side salad and an iced Nutella Mocha that they promote as "the only Nutella Mocha in the valley" which isn't true. I've been to plenty of coffee shops that offer Nutella coffees in the valley. The Mocha was underwhelming. The Nutella didn't shine through at all, it just tasted like a milky Mocha. The Stacked Turkey had quite a bit of Turkey on it, the bread was delicious, and it had a horseradish Dijon spread that had a bite too it. I almost with there was a little less sauce because it overpowered it a bit. Other than that it was a fine sandwich. Nothing to write home about. The salad wasn't good. Small pile of leaves with a tasteless oil dripped on it.

I'm writing this review on my second visit. I got the Caramel Blended Freeze (they call it something similar to Starbucks' Frappuccino) and The OMG (prosciutto, mascarpone, fig, and honey sandwich) with a side tomato bisque soup. The soup is delicious, but pretty small. The Caramel Freeze was better than the Nutella Mocha, but not by much. It was still really milky and not too much flavor to it. It tasted like a milkshake made out of milk and ice with caramel drizzled in the cup. The real star of this show (besides the soup) is The OMG. This sandwich is an adventure of flavor. I literally said 'oh my god' out loud after my first bite. It's subtly sweet at first and takes you on a gentle rollercoaster ride as it turns salty in the best possible way. This sandwich is a work of art.
Hot Chocolate Nutela... Yeah you have to have some. The food was great.

10/2 update - My husband and I went here for dinner a couple weeks ago.  The food and wine were fantastic and a great value.  We ate inside - what a cozy, friendly atmosphere, and the service was superb.  It felt like family but without all the annoying family members.   Also on our way in, we noticed the misters on the patio so maybe we were too dumb and/or oblivious to notice them on our previous visit.  All in all, a yummy, romantic, fun dinner so I've upgraded it a star.  We will be back!  Btw if you like serious food porn and occasionally Facebook only specials, like them on Facebook.  

**********************************
We enjoyed brunch here today and would give this more stars if the service had been better.  The food and drinks were great.  I had the yogurt and granola which was yummy.  My husband had the breakfast croissant which he said was good.  We topped it off with mimosas and a cappuccino.  Prices are reasonable.  

The place is as everyone else has described - totally unexpected cute, cozy place in a rundown shopping center.  We had our dogs so sat on the patio which is nice and makes you feel you aren't next to a busy intersection but really needs misters.

One guy at the counter was great though harried.  He was efficient, very enthusiastic and nice, even bringing treats for our dogs.  The girl - not so much.  She wasn't friendly, was way in the weeds in terms of service, and for some reason, felt it appropriate to yell at the nice guy in front of all the customers.  Apparently there was some separation of duties that he wasn't respecting, but it was clear she was in the weeds badly and needed help.  

We were really happy to support a local business and will go here again.  They do need to address the service issues as several reviewers have pointed out.  The drive-thru was constantly busy while we were there, and there was a good crowd inside.  We were the only ones on the patio.  They need to find a balance between serving the drive-thru and inside customers.  I cannot imagine how they could've handled it if the patio and inside were full in addition to the drive-thru.

One last thing - I think they could turn the music volume down just a touch.  All in all, we enjoyed our visit and will definitely be back!
Fun place, great environment, good vibes. Food is average. Quality of booze is average. Will come again.

I've been here twice now, once for dinner when we sat outside and enjoyed a variety of dishes to share, all were quite tasty.  Then also did the drive thru this morning for their cheddar/bacon waffles.  Again, quite tasty.  Will for sure be back.  While the weather is nice out, definitely sit outside, it's a nice relaxing ambiance and the staff is very friendly!  I've recommended this place on Diners, Drive in's and Dives show too.  Must continue to get the word out about this place!

Great happy hour spot that's relatively tucked away. The location is actually an old photo hut, which explains the small size. The patio is the place to be--inside is a little cramped and noisy. You won't exactly be able to spread out on the patio but it's still nice and cozy. It's dog friendly, too!

Drinks are super affordable during happy hour, and the food specials are delicious. We haven't tried a bruschetta we didn't like, and the turkey sliders are delicious, too. We tend to just order small plates and drinks and hang out until the sun goes down. It's a great place to wind down on a Thursday or Friday night as a couple or in a small group. I would imagine large groups would be a challenge.

Service is overall good--they get a little frazzled sometimes but when we're there we're never in a hurry to leave. First round of drinks and apps always comes fast :).

Great local place. Delicious coffee that is not too strong and not bland nor cheap in flavoring their flavored coffee. I tried the iced caramel macchiato twice and Mocha once. Both times it knocked me into heaven. So delicious. Muffins are great!  Moist and full of flavor. The best part about their muffins is they make them fresh and do not carry the regular Flavors you see everywhere else. I tried their Pineapple Coconut muffin. Wow!  Fantastic!  

The only reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars would be because, although the service is friendly, it is just so slow. Each time I have been here I was not anxious nor in a hurry to be some place. So the way I see it, if I am in no hurry and the service STILL seems slow well then that, my friend, is some sloooow service.

Went here for the first time yesterday for a late lunch. Had a wonderful vegetarian sandwich and added their horseradish sauce. It was fantastic. Chips tasted fresh and had great flavor. Very cool outdoor atmosphere and dog friendly. Nice selection of sandwiches, salads, and drinks.
Really enjoyed the flavor + texture of my lavender latte. Overall, though, between the service, space, and food it felt like something was missing.

This place had some of the best drinks. The Nutella iced mocha and the iced vanilla lavender mocha are to die for! If you love your chocolate I recommend the iced Nutella mocha. The environment is very urban and chill. I would definitely come again.

We love 32 Shea and it has always been our neighborhood "go to." We used to come here with our sweet dog over the last 5 years and it was a weekly event we always looked forward to. When he passed away at age 15 it was hard to imagine coming here without him but the staff, the food, and the ambiance has brought us back. Their dog friendly patio will be waiting for our next rescue when we find him, her, or them.
Had a business meeting that turn out to be a great time at 32shea.  The drinks were amazing. Nice job 32shea.
We went 2nd year in a row for Valentine Day dinner. Romantic, delicious dinner and friendly smiling staff.

Rebecca the owner has transformed this place into a little haven right in the heart of north Phoenix. 

Whether you love happy hour (12 hours - 6-6) or local great food (veg or gf, no problem) or you just want a great cup of java (they even have a drive through), 32 Shea is the place for you. 

Pet friendly on the outdoor patio which is absolutely wonderful with a gorgeous water feature and trees - sure to become a favorite. 

I'm now a regular and I'm hooked - it's cool, convenient and cute, and Rebecca has created a culture of excellence and friendliness of service in her peeps - love love!!

Oh my goodness! This place has the worst service of any place I have ever been. They ignore you. And it is a very small place. There were only five people in the whole interior of the building. We are literally less than six feet away and yet they acted like we were invisible. Yet we left him a nice tip. I'm not sure why? I guess it was because we wanted to show them that we were better people than they were.
Great spot to eat, drink,  or just hang out.  Food is great and the drinks are just as good.

One of my favorite go-to places whenever I'm in North Phoenix. Last week was the first time trying the dinner menu, and it was fabulous.  I like their lunch staples (esp. the OMG sandwich).  I'm a supporter of this local business that serves quality food and drinks at reasonable prices.

Been her for breakfast and coffee a couple of times, had lunch today - always a pleasant visit especially when weather is nice and can sit outside.  Inside dining room is small.  Place can get busy but for a reason.  Food is fresh and good.  Unique options.  Worth the visit if in the area and need a coffee or meal.  Prices are reasonable too.   Well done!

Love this little coffee place. Not much from the outside, but the food is fresh and delicious and so are their homemade syrups. Lavender is my favorite. Yum. 
Support local businesses!!! Call ahead and they have it waiting for you, even better.

One of my favorite places to get a sandwich. Their sandwiches are always good quality and fresh. My favorite is the OMG sandwich and the Roastbeef (I normally do not eat roastbeef but I love it there!). Would highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking to enjoy amazing sandwichs!

One of favorite little haunts! It's amazing the production that comes out of a kitchen that's basically the size of a small bedroom. The Nutella Mocha is THE reason I go there. They offer non-dairy options. The verde salsa that comes with breakfast burrito is excellent! Love it love it!

Love this little spot! Great food and drinks. Very chilax place to hang out at. 
Service is overall good and they have a funky, fun bathroom!!

I had been to this place three or four times before this visit.  Food is good but service seems to be subpar always.

This last visit was particularly bad.  We entered the restaurant and stood around waiting for somebody to guide us to a place to sit.  Finally, a guy comes over and asks our preference and we tell him outdoors will be fine.  He seats us and we wait for about five minutes.  Finally, a waitress (Ithink the owner) comes over and tells us harshly "you can't sit here".  I say "we were seated by a waiter".  She says you can't sit here.  I ask why.  She says, "because it is reserved for a large group".  I say "where can we sit".  She leads us to the indoor seating.  We sat and waited for 20 minutes.  Nobody attempted to wait on us.  Finally, we got up and walked out.  Saw her again on the way out and said,'your service sucks".  She just looked at me - no apology, no excuses.  This lady is evil.  Saw a broom in a parking space on the way to the car.  Surmised it must be her mode of transportation.  This is unfortunate.  This place has the ability to be a real bright spot in our neigborhood.  Unfortunately, bad ownership or help can ruin what could be a great experience.

32 Shea is a great place to go all times of the day. You can swing by and grab your work coffee and treat, stop by with your fur babies and enjoy their patio after a hike, or to meet for lunch. We also love their Monday night Lavish and bottle of wine for a date night!! Their coffee and drink menu is A+ and there is something for everyone!!!

32 Shea is a real little oasis.  We recently moved to the North 32nd district and we love it!  They have great food, drinks and atmosphere.  They have a beautiful patio that is a real escape from the Arizona summer and is perfect for date night (like last night), as well as meeting business associates there during the day, as I often do.  The Manager, Karyn is wonderful and together with a great team has this little gem really sparkling!

Great little outdoor spot in AZ for coffee and conversation.  I've only visited once but loved the ambience and enjoyed being able to have a good coffee while my friend had wine.  Great friendly staff too!

This is our neighborhood go to spot when we decide to grab a bite to eat on the fly. We love it!! Inside can get crowded quickly in the evenings or weekend afternoons but the patio is a nice seating option that we have often taken advantage of, especially during the cooler months! We always get fantastic service, and the lobster mac & cheese is absolutely positively to die for!   The salads are all delicious, and portions are not small but not too large either!  During our drinking days, we treated ourselves to their blueberry margaritas which are phenomenal and are seasoned with fresh blueberries!  Now the iced tea is our drink of choice!  Highly recommend this little gem that's packed with atmosphere and a quality menu!

Adorable little place! Great coffee drinks! The sandwiches were great too. The tuna my looked awesome as did the sliders that kept going by. I tried the turkey sandwich which was great. 

They were very dog friendly. We sat on the patio with our small group of people and group of dogs. It was great to have a place like this to enjoy food when we had the dogs  with us. 

I recommend the mocha Nutella latte! It was fantastic! The cocktails looked fantastic too!

Great coffees and cold brews. Much better tasting and better priced than Starbucks. And locally owned! I've only had the breakfast sandwich. Good fresh ingredients. Will be back to try more and use the patio. Only have done the drive thru.
Love this place! Good food, good people, and great drinks. Love their breakfast menu and the iced Toddy! Dog friendly and super cute cozy atmosphere with a great patio.

Loving this local spot for brunch or happy hour al fresco patio dining.  One of those fun places that vibes coffee house or wine bar.

Very reasonable $5 New Mexican burrito for breakfast with eggs, hash-browns, bacon, guacamole with a spicy oniony green salsa.

Love the Nutella mocha- the hazelnut balances the espresso without being artificially sweet.

For happy hour the food is ok but I'm loving the fresh cocktails.

The staff is super busy but lacking in smiles.  They obviously see some annoying people through the day but really?
This place has one of the best happy hours for cocktails. The best patio which is dog friendly,one of our dogs favorite places to go and relax.

This is such a fun place.  It is an oasis in a parking lot.   Their trees offer great shade year round, and their strung lights allow you to sink away into the evening.  The food isn't bad and the coffee is nice too!
  I am excited to back with a friend for a glass of wine.

This place is a gem and I'm lucky to live so close to it. I go there way too much, for food, coffee, or just to sit and study. They always have something different on their dinner menu, so it's worth following their facebook feed to get alerts on what new dish they've whipped up each night. 

For coffee several highlights are their Americano (great flavor), their Mochas (you can get them with nutella instead of chocolate syrup) and their drip coffee is great too. 

For drinks they have a great wine selection and some creative spins on martinis, including their espresso-tini (amazing drink). 

For food I love their new mexico burrito, their toasted nutella & banana sandwich, but can't beat their OMG sandwich (hands down the highlight of their menu) with mascarpone, figs, honey and prosciutto on toasted ciabatta. Great dinner selections and the plus there is the variety each night.
Good happy hour and an ok breakfast just wished they served it later on the weekends because I like to sleep in and then have a late breakfast like at 2pm lol

So sad to say this, but things have changed here.  Let me start off by saying we have loved this place for years and don't typically write negative reviews - especially for special local shops like this one with lots great folks behind them.  

But the past 3 times we have encountered problems.  Missing items, extremely burned toast, etc. 

Today's example:  

We always order the Yummy Yummy in my Tummy which on the menu explicitly states:

Yummy Yummy in My Tummy | 3.5
Warm Nutella + Fresh Bananas on Toasted Bread

Simple right??  Nutella, bananas, bread.  

As you can see in our photo, they substituted the Nutella with peanut butter. (We weren't notified).  Normally not a big deal, and we are pretty easy going -  but this kind of stuff keeps happening and it's a bummer.

this place is super cute but SO disappointed with my food quality & then the response I got after mentioning it to one of the servers!
I ordered the caprese sandwich on gluten free bread with a side salad.. I'm not sure what happened but my bread was completely soaked in dressing & soggy & inedible. feel like it must have just sat there waiting for my dining partner's order to come out. also the mozzarella (which should be the best part) was hard & rubbery - totally inedible as well! ..reminded me of dried glue. I let one of the servers know so next time they could prepare it better! instead she asked me if I wanted to now talk to the owner... no I just wanted to pass on that it wasn't a good experience & I was disappointed! ..not talk to 3 different people about how bad it was while they look down at me. she tried to blame it on the gluten free bread - but that was actually really good! just not the bottom pieces that were soaked & soggy... be nice to your customers! cute environment, good mimosa, but subpar food & weird vibes when trying to pass on a message to management.

I absolutely love this place.  Here are my personal reasons:

-They have nutella coffee... that deserves 5 stars alone.  
-They have great customer service.  They nearly always remember my husband's name since he is in there more often than I am.  
-You can call in your coffee order ahead of time.... what?! Yes, you really can.  This is an amazing thing!  Take that Starbucks!  
-They have great food and on Tuesday nights you can get $20 for a bottle of wine and bruschetta.  Don't get me wrong, I love Postino's for this deal, but this place actually has parking without the hassle!
-You can bring your dog...although it seems like very few people take advantage of this.
-They have bike racks for when we ride our beach cruisers over instead of walking
-It's walking distance
-Cute patio with misters and fresh herbs growing all around
-The Nutella/Espresso martini.  It's no longer on the menu (or wasn't last time I was in), but I've asked and they've still made it for me.  So. Freaking.Good.

If you aren't convinced yet, stop reading this and just go try it out.  

Don't expect a huge menu or a large indoor seating area.  It's tiny and it's meant to be a great, tiny, local spot.  Go when the weather is nice and sit outside while sipping a nutella martini and eating bruschetta.  If you're disappointed, then I'm not sure what to tell you.

Fantastic drive-thru service the VERY BEST and i have workd at coffe shops thank you all for your amazing window serviceI am a solo biz owner oF 30 plus years  I no how hard it becomes to "manage"it all .... so my review is to  the owner Rebecca for keeping this all together..  you have a great location great menu great events and a great staff thank you for all you do  and  remember our new word is ...NEXT.... HairDoc TK

I'm right up the road from here and it is my default choice when I want something well-priced without a long wait. The serving sizes are perfect! I don't like to eat much first thing in the morning so I order a $5 item which fills me up. My husband who is just shy of six and a half feet tall orders two items ($10 total) unless he is just wanting a snack. I can't stand when places are expensive just to be expensive and could easily give you 2/3 of the food at 2/3 of the cost and be reasonable, this place solves that problem for me. 

They also have alcohol for any time of day... that makes me sound like an alcoholic, but I'm sure you can understand what I mean. If you want a morning cocktail, they have mimosas and bloodys (though you'd seriously injure a vamp with your garlic breath after their bloodys). Lunch rolls around and you want a glass of wine, they've got you covered. Don't feel like cooking dinner and want to let loose with a cocktail, they've got a ton of options. 

For about a month, I had an obsession with caprese salads (I still do, but it has lessened) and theirs is only $6 so I'd get a caprese with a sauv blanc for lunch or go through the drive thru on my way home from work which is surprisingly quick. They have so many options that are very affordable. I definitely recommend it!
We really like having a nice neighborhood place that can serve a great glass of wine as well as a terrific breakfast burrito!

I have been going here for years and cannot believe I haven't taken the time to write a review yet! So many reasons this place deserves a 5 star rating. I will start with the bathroom. Sometimes bathrooms do not get enough credit. Check this one out, I'll leave it at that. Food = amazing. Drinks = amazing. Service = amazing. Patio = even more amazing. And it's dog friendly! This is a place you do not want to pass up.

Me and my boyfriend decided to go here after struggling to find a place in the area that was open on Christmas Eve. We ordered the Tuna Melt and the open faced grilled cheese and both entrees came with a side salad. Everything was amazing and the outdoor seating was quite nice. The prices were not too high and the service was excellent. Definitely going back before I head back to California.

Do yourself a favor and get the OMG...I think it might be the best sandwich I've ever had. Tomato basil bisque with grilled cheese croutons, Yes, I said grilled cheese croutons. Sooo good. Great cute hidden gem, and great quality food...friendly service!

I am probably here at least once a week.  I work nearby and this place is a great spot for breakfast on the go (I always order ahead) amazing lattes, solid lunch sandwiches and great drinks after work.

It is a treat to have a great spot for coffee/tea, or a bite to eat here in the neighborhood. I am currently loving the seasonal Pumpkin Spice Chai Latte made with real pumpkin purée. The homemade Nutella Cheesecake is also a must have if you save room for a treat! The staff is friendly and fun to chat with. There will usually be some sort of hustle and bustle happening as 32 is a popular spot (also depending on when you're in) but it is always comfortable and laid back. When the weather is nice, sitting on the patio is a must! I do wish the shopping center where this is located had more (improved) stores or restaurants. 32 Shea is without a doubt the best thing happening at this intersection! I highly recommend this spot for both out of town visitors and Phoenix locals!

What an awesome spot in an unexpected place.

Great food, great service and fair prices.

I had the special I'd the day (Wednesday is burger and shake).

The burger was good although I would rather have fries instead I'd sweet potatoes but oh well.

The coffee is pretty good too and they have home made syrups.

Cheers

Fun fact. There's a comfy chair I'm the bathroom wtf?

What's not to love about this adorable neighborhood spot?
We love their hummus, spinach and artichoke appetizers.
They also have a yummy selection of bruschetta.
We enjoy coming here for brunch as well.
They have wonderful happy hour specials.
The outdoor seating area has a lovely ambience when the weather is cool enough to enjoy it.
Awesome place to grab something healthy on the go thanks to their drive-thru!! Very reasonably priced for the quality of food!! I have found a new spot!!! Thank you!!

I love the New Mexico breakfast burrito, something so simple but delicious! The coffee is great ..I prefer caramel with caramel sauce only freezacino! They are very accommodating staff! Eating local is fun!

I love this little place. Beautiful outdoor setting (inside is a bit small) with shade, umbrellas, misters and the ability to have protection from the traffic on 32nd Street Their drive-thru is fast, even though they have you pull forward and then bring your food out to you. 

This is also a dog-friendly place on the patio, very cute little features for dogs (and dog parents). 

Service is good and fast. You can tell they try to be efficient and accommodating. I have tried only the breakfast items since I'm out early hiking with my dogs. But I'm bringing my daughter here next time she visits (in November to run Ironman Tempe). There are lots of athletes who stop in here, as well as businessmen and women, and casual friend meetups.

I've watched this little spot go from completely unknown to the beautiful inviting oasis away from it all that it is now and on top of it being beautiful they have wonderful food and great service. I would highly suggest making time to stop by for drinks and lunch!

5 stars for ambiance. Great outdoor area very green and lush even though it's in the middle of a parking lot. Dog friendly! Cozy and intimate. 

Sometimes confusing if you're supposed to order at the front or if they come around to take your order. I've had it both ways and can't figure it out. 

3 stars for food. Bruschetta is yummy and good value. Other items are okay. Menu is limited since kitchen is small and have few items. Portions are small-medium. Mildly overpriced. Breakfast is so-so. Probably wouldn't get that again. The green smoothie comes from a bottle. Not fresh produce. 

Would still come back because overall hangout spot is nice and close to home.

32 Shea is a true gems of my neighborhood. I was raised a few blocks from it, went to Shadow Mountain and bought my own home in the area 9 years ago. I'd seen this place change hands a million times. My brother is a true foodie and we both prefer to support mom and pops over the corporate chains. We took our dogs and were very  impressed. Between the cleanliness, upbeat atmosphere, delicious fresh ingredients and beautiful presentation, this place has it all. The happy hour specials are fantastic and well priced.  The fresh mozzarella and basil sandwich is to die for. nothing quite as heavenly as a relaxing morning with a breakfast burrito and Java concoction from 32 Shea. I've enjoyed the drive thru for delicious coffee drinks. I'm usually a Starbucks girl, but am making a concerted effort to keep the little guy in business. I gave this place a 5 star rating because for the most part it is just that. I have had some less than ideal encounters the past few times. A few of which left me not wanting to come back. For awhile my drive through orders were always inconsistent. Vastly different taste and texture than the exact same drink. (Their version of a caramel frap). I'm not big on complaining, but the third time it wasn't even close to what the owner had made. I   asked if it could be remade. This was not well received. There was no one behind me. I don't know if it was remade or not, but the second one was equally bad. I just took it and left. I always had great success with the owners and decided I'd just go if I had the time to go in.. I've gone once since that time and it was strange. On our only visit for dinner,  we were treated poorly and walked out. Being in recovery, we don't drink. This appeared to annoy our server and we were not given the good service received during lunch or breakfast visits. I'd still recommend 32 Shea based on food quality and presentation, it's just not a place I'll frequent for dinner.

Roast beef sandwich was very good. Service was not great. Would definitely go back and try other menu items. Four stars because the food was great,  and there isn't anything else near me with comperable food. I'd say it's priced fairly.
This place is just absolutely quaint, quiet and beautiful! I really enjoy the food but most importantly, the coffee! If you're looking for a place to relax and unwind, this is the place!

This place is a great little cafe right in an area which needs life brought back into it. I always feel better buying coffee and food here as I know the money stays here. What better way to improve the neighborhood. Owners passion really is evident when you see her working her butt off all while keeping a smile. Josh and Jeff best in the BIZ!

Update: I've been back a few times since my initial review and the last 2 times I have ordered and paid  cold brew, I've been given warm and watered down iced coffee. If you're out of cold brew just tell me! Don't serve me some hot water and call it cold brew.

Good food but the service is always terrible. I feel like each time I go the wait times get longer and longer especially in the drive thru. I went for breakfast and got half my order in 10 minutes but had to wait an additional 15 for the rest of it! First half was cold by the time I got everything.

THE best Lox & Bagel for only $7.50!
This cute little joint does salmon right. They cure their own salmon and serve it with a good amount of cream cheese, a toasted bagel, slivered red onion, a carrot and daikon mixture and capers (they need to add a few more capers to each order, i only had 4 on each half and I really like those little buggers). 
They have happy hour all day so you can accompany your breakfast with a $5 mimosa.
