OMG! I'm a huge breakfast fan and this place has nailed it! The food was delicious, fresh & done right. The Early Bird Sandwich is so freakin good, the egg nice and fluffy (made me a little worried when I seen it), bacon nice & crispy, the perfect amount of avocado & mayo! My son had the New Mexico Burrito it was also really good! For coffee I had the Nutella Latte and it was the perfect balance of flavor, not too sweet so it was perfect for me. I can't wait to go back for happy hour (6am-6pm) WOW! A little tip if you are going when it's extremely hot outside, they have very limited indoor seating but a very nicely shaded outdoor area. Be prepared to sit outside no matter what time you go! Overall I really love this place!

The drinks are amazing. The food is fabulous. They are always so busy and usually the servers are running around. Like any where, some seem pretty uninterested. The chef fortunately makes up for the table service. Which, I think table service doesn't even start till 4p. Before that it's a multi-tasking bar/barista. Great spot. The owner surly know how to design a place, make good drinks, and good food.

Came here last Saturday for lunch with my mom and dad.  I'm pretty sure this used to be one of those photo huts when I was growing up.  The place is tiny inside.  Cute, but a bit noisy.  If it was cooler outside, it would have been great to sit on the patio.  

The sandwiches were good.  I had the turkey which I thought was a bit bland, but you could tell it was made with good ingredients.  My dad had a BLT that he said was excellent, and my mom had the roast beef sandwich with the horseradish cream sauce.  I wish I had gotten that!!!!  It was delicious!  Next time I go back, I will have that for sure.

Their coffees looked nice, and I would like to try them as well.

I will be going back for that sandwich.  It's a very cute little place.  Nice addition to 32nd Street!  Good to see a little gem in the old neighborhood.

Oh hey, everything likable about Phoenix cafes.

- dope hipster tunage 
- cafe-to-speakeasy shapeshifting abilities from morning to evening
- better coffee than most coffee shops
- the awesome tuna sandwich on great bread official third-party seal of approval
- high quality ingredients, but very simple fare
- a virtually unlimited supply of Nutella (okay, not in most Phoenix cafes, but should be)

Yes, 32 Shea, just yes.

The Buddhist-peace theme on the patio was kind of wrecked as I had to listen to a song by a black musician railing against "mother f#&ker's" and "niggers". Huh? What kind of lunch is that? Who picked that station?

Also, I have to admit it is over priced by about $1.50-$2 per entree. At least mine was.

I love this little place! They have done some great work on their patio to up the aesthetics. It very nice out there with the trees, lighting, and little waterfall. A great spot to go on a beautiful AZ spring or fall night. 

I've been there both during lunch and dinner. They have signature sandwiches and salads to chose from, I like their caprese sandwich. Super yummy! It's a nice spot that offers some healthier options and good ingredients. 

I would recommend coming here during their happy hour and sit to have a glass of wine and some artichoke dip on their patio! Perfection. Their staff is always incredibly friendly and accommodating. 

Another great thing about their patio is that it's pet friendly. They even have hooks for leashes and water bowls on hand for your pups. It's locally owned and I love when you can feel the warmth and dedication in a spot and 32 Shea exudes that.

Okay so I'm not a yelper whatsoever! But I couldn't not post about this place!! I'm in the hospitality industry so my standards are very high!!! This is Such a little gem, I go weekly! So consistent with there food, the patio is amazing and I take my puppy all the time! The staff are ahhhmazing as well!!! LOVE THIS PLACE  

Get the lox bagel!!!

I love this place! It's so versatile. There's a drive thru that's open until 4pm. Their coffee is delicious! The patio area is beautiful and also dog friendly! It's a great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner! It's even great for just enjoying some drinks on the patio! I just visited this place for the first time about a month ago and I've been back at least 4 times!

What a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT !!! Went here for lunch and I have been excited to try this place very cute and quaint , the menu sounded delicious and the staff was friendly enough . My review is based solely off of portion size and quality of freshness . I ordered the lunch caprese salad and asked the guy if it was a big salad or should I order something else to go along with it he said no that salad was big enough . I got it to go and when I got home I was very surprised with what they call a salad ?  there were 4 slices of mozzarella which was an ok portion but there was 4 tiny shreds of lettuce on top that did not even cover the cheese not surround it oh And some rotting tomatoes ? It was not even edible besides the cheese I really wanted to like this place but don't think know that I will be returning :(

"Let's have coffee!" Amanda B. said.
So I got there early. I hooked myself up to super fast wi-fi. I cursed myself for having stuffed myself already as the menu looked delicious. After hugs were shared I watched enviously as Amanda returned to the table with wine. At lunch time.

Apparently Happy Hour is a twelve hour thing.
TWELVE HOURS.

Did you hear me?
(Dine in only. This is stipulated on the menu. Who tries to take HH to go? Apparently SOME PEOPLE. 32 Shea does have a drive thru.)

So from 6AM to 6PM folks can enjoy the following:
$4 bottled craft beer
$5 wine, mimosa, bloody mary
$6 martinis, cocktails

AND then (!) they have a 2-hr munchie hour
4pm-6pm (again, dine in only kids)
$3 bruschetta
$5 munchie menu (which they put on the chalk board)

See here's the thing. If you're a writer, this place is dangerous. You'd never get a damn thing done. You'd show up bright and early for breakfast (which is served until noon), enjoy coffee, move onto a smoothie and then lunch. (The green smoothie is *excellent*.) At some point a beve would make sense, right? And then, well, it's drinking time?

This is an adorable cozy space. You will fall in love with it. Oops! I got all sorts of excited and left something out. You place your order up front at the cashier and food is brought to you. Tables are cleared for you. 

I took a menu to keep in my car. YES, I did that. This place isn't in my neck of the woods. However, I cannot wait to grab food the next opportunity I'm up here again!

UPDATE: While you're here be sure to try the New Mexican burrito. The green salsa is to die for. (I'm hoping they start selling this to go soon.) Garlic, jalapeños, cilantro, tomatoes, onion, and some other heaven. I can't remember what else Rebecca, the super cool owner, described with zest. She's currently sporting purple short hair. All the employes rock. There's a punky and fun vibe going on here. Good times :)

Love this place!  Bonus points 'cause it's in my hood.

What's not to love about a 32 Shea?  Not just anyone can turn a vacant fast food restaurant in a strip mall parking lot into a top notch coffee shop.  But the awesome doesn't end there.  By day, they are a coffee shop that serves delicious food, has a full bar and some of the coolest, most fun baristas in the city.  By night, 32 Shea is the perfect place to grab a glass of wine and some amazing bruschetta, or the dinner of the day with an delicious craft beer or even a lavosh pizza and a mint lemon drop martini (holy yumminess). 

The homemade green salsa and bloody mary mix are not to be missed!

**Friend 32 Shea on Facebook or follow them on Twitter to make sure you never miss out on the awesome daily deals they offer.  Another bonus is that you will always know what the dinner of the day is!

Great place to go for a drink and a bite. I always like to go at dusk on warm evenings and sit outside on the patio, which is truely wonderful. This is a small place, intimate and welcoming and the food is lite and excellent. The edibles are perfect with a variety of sandwiches and salads as well as bruschetta, everything fresh and savory. The bruschetta is wonderful and the variety is impressive. While my husband and I have gone for a light dinner and to split a bottle of wine this is not somewhere to go if you are looking for a full blown or heavy dinner. It is however a perfect place to go for a first date, coffee date, drive through morning excellence, nightcap and light desert. This is an impressive neighborhood staple and has made an impression far and wide. It just kinda feels like your sitting in your best friends living-room listening to music and sipping a martini.
This place is great for breakfast, brunch or dinner (never been for lunch yet).  Love their dog friendly outside patio and the food is always delicious!

I really like this place, food is great, coffee is great.  Service is usually good, but there are no high chair's, so its not really "Good for Kids".  I know the inside is very tight, but the patio has room.

The coffee here was really good.  The food was "okay."  I've tried the turkey sandwich and the early bird sandwich.  The early bird sandwich was good, but not sure it's worth the price since I could probably make it myself.  It comes on regular old sandwich bread and you don't get any sides.  I bet this place is more fun at night when it's a wine bar.

So yesterday I had a training right near this little place and I went here....twice.....whoa. I went in the morning and had the nutella mocha....now, I don't even really like mochas that much, but this was a completely different story. It wasn't too sweet, but it was sweet, and it had that nutty and delicious Nutella flavor.....oh my. Thank god I don't live near here or I would be spending a lot of money and calories on this delicious drink. Anyway, I came back for lunch (but they were still serving breakfast). I got their New Mexican breakfast burrito and it was alright, but not as good as many say. I really like the green chili sauce that came with the burrito, but the burrito itself was pretty generic. Anyway, I would like to come back and try their lunch or dinner food and I will definitely be back for a nutella mocha (but not too soon!).

Love it! It is close and convenient. The food was good. The staff was very helpful. I like the atmosphere.

It is very small so we sat outside. I would go there again.

Really enjoyed this restaurant in the past. Good food and good service. Went there tonight and sat on their patio with our dog. Only 3 other tables occupied. The waitress walked in and out of the restaurant 5 times without so much as a mention that she would "be with us in a minute" Left after being ignored for 35 minutes. Very disappointing

I can't really add anything to the exceptional reviews 32 Shea has earned. I'll just say that I wish I lived closer so I could stop in more often. Integrity in service, great vibe and local. Keep doing what you're doing, guys.

A hidden gem! Initially I thought this was a drive thru coffee stand. To my surprise they serve breakfast, lunch dinner and happy hour. An adorable pet friendly patio that was busy what look like with local patrons. Inside tables and bar seating. Cozy fit and counter service for lunch. Check out the unique bathroom. The entire staff was extremely friendly and going the extra mile to make every guest welcome.

I love Shea 32 for the amazing patio and laid back vibe. I was surprised to find this little gem in a half empty strip mall at the edge of a residential neighborhood. I have now been there a number of times- both for lunch and dinner- and have liked everything I tried. They have a killer sandwich called the OMG that I just can't get enough of - figs, prosciutto, mascarpone and honey on perfectly chewy ciabatta. For dinner they have excellent Bruschetta as well as revolving daily specials and an excellent wine selection. This is the perfect place for a romantic dinner outside on the Patio in the cooler months.
Such a cute coffee shop with good vibes and good drinks! Their nutella coffee and lavender latte are my favorite!

The food is always top notch and the so are the drinks.  Come to think of it so is the vibe and the service, so I guess that makes it a no brainer.  It has some constants on the menu that are all good and everyday there is a new entree which has always been awesome.  Go check it out, you won't regret it.
What!? Yelp weekly didn't mention 32 Shea...THEY HAVE S'MORE LATTES!! So yummy. They have great holiday drinks. I also love the peppermint WHITE mocha!

I love locals.  I love anyone who will go through the trouble, and hard work, to open a place of business.  Let me tell you, seeing the condition of this building when my wife and I first moved into the neighborhood; the owners wanted to REALLY open this place because they had to put A LOT of work into it.  But, no surprise, it has paid off.

First off, I am more of a tea (Chai, yum!) than a coffee person, so I can't speak to the taste of their coffee drinks, but they smell fantastic!

My hot chai from here, is ALWAYS great.  Always hot, without being too hot, and has a consistent flavor each time.  

The food (sandwiches, salads, and coming soon, soups) always look and smell very fresh.

I have had the:

Early Bird (Egg, Tomato, Avocado and Mayo on English muffin (with your choice of bacon or turkey)

New Mexico Burrito (Egg, Potatoes, Cheese, Avocado, Bacon) and a side of homemade Green Salsa (not a lot of heat, which I like, but still very taste),

Stacked Turkey (Tomato, Lettuce, Avocado, Provolone, Mustard+Mayo)

I would recommend all three, and will recommend other foods too, as soon as I tear myself away from the above. :)

I am looking forward to when they get to have beer/wine dinner events, and I don't want to forget to mention the retro Pepsi (in glass bottles!).

Please visit this place, you will enjoy the pleasant interior, or gorgeous outdoor seating and the very reasonable prices too!

Always solid. Been here for happy hour, breakfast burritos, and coffee. Everything is top-notch and the service is fantastic. I love the attention to detail that they put into all their work--especially the breakfast burritos! Check them out. (You can even call ahead, plus they have a drive thru!) Highly recommended!
I love this place. I have only been by for coffee and breakfast and it is one if my favs! The coffee is great and the lox bagel is AMAZING! You must at least stop by to try their coffee.

Very interesting place especially in the afternoon great crowd good customer service highly recommend you may have to spend a little extra but I think it's worth it give it a shot I don't think you will regret it
Really cute but unorganized. Not a lot of room to stand if ordering takeout. Coffee was very good and service was friendly.

32 Shea is a great place for a meeting, casual brunch, or laid-back dinner. We come here often when we want good food in a relaxed atmosphere. It's also great for a casual work meeting place, as there's plenty inside and outside seating and the noise level is low.

Staff is always friendly and the food is pretty good. I wish there were more neighborhood-type restaurants like this around.
The breakfast burrito is AMAZING! Outstanding service, delicious coffee, and the place itself is super cute and unique. Definitely recommend this spot, its a gem.

As a Phoenix native, back for the holidays, I was looking forward to enjoying an old favorite of mine. I I used to frequent 32 Shea when it first opened, and since moving away, make an attempt to eat there at least twice whenever I am back I town. I was looking forward to a quality meal in a lovely atmosphere. The restaurant was a little empty, so I was expecting maybe a softer atmosphere, but to my surprise, the manager seemed to just talk louder at her employees. My cocktails were prepared incorrectly by the same manager who seemed more eager to close up early than to pay attention to the patrons. I was unclear as to who I should order from as people informed her she had a diner and she just ordered the others to do tasks for her, while she reminisced about drinking and talked about leaving for her new job. She infantilized her employees as though talking to small children, when some of them seemed to be older and more mature than her. The food, per usual was amazing, but the single individual who seemed more than happy to be gone and starting a new job while brushing all responsibility off onto her employees, all but ruined my meal. Next time I will stick to the outside seating area. Thank you for continuing to provide quality food!
I can't say enough good things about this place. Excellent coffee, great food, and the people that work here are awesome! Love the atmosphere and they have a drive through!!

Love our favorite local coffee shop, 32 Shea. Everything here is amazing. The cocktails, the coffee, the food, and the service! I recommend calling ahead if you're going to go through the drive through. The lavender white mocha is my favorite coffee drink - I highly recommend! If you've never been here, you must try it!

Cutest little coffee shop that turns into a bar on the evenings. I met a girlfriend here for brunch and coffee. It was delicious and I just love the look of the place. It's a fun date night or a good spot to bring the laptop to get some work done. Love little gems like this!

I'm really disappointed to leave a negative review. I have been a regular at 32 Shea for almost 4 years. I fell in love with it when I came here for lunch, and decided to come back for breakfast and coffee. Their coffee is amazing and their food is really good, for good prices. 

However, the experience and service is extremely inconsistent. I ordered breakfast this morning and waited 45 minutes for it. 3 other couples that ordered after I did; they received their food, ate it, and left before I even had a chance to ask them where my order went. 

When it was brought to my table, it was placed in front of me with no, "sorry about the wait," or explanation as to what happened. 

I know you are a small, local business trying to make it work. Consistency is what builds a brand and builds success - I think you need some help standardizing the expectations for your employees to ensure guests receive the same, great experience time and time again. 

I invite you to visit 32 Shea for great food and even better drinks, but it'll be hit or miss on timing and guest service.
The restaurant has been sold, so I will reserve judgement of that for 6 months to see what the new owners do. Good things I hope.

I arrived at the funky lil joint this morning, and was pleasantly surprised that I did not have to sit in the long stream of cars in the drive-thru line. The gentleman at the window was friendly and patient, he suggested the Vanilla/Honey Latte Iced, this was my first experience here so I was grateful for the suggestion. It was FANTASTIC! I also ordered the breakfast burrito which was delicious, (their home made salsa was perfect) & it did NOT weigh 10lbs so I still feel fantastic after devouring it, not like I want to curl up, clenching my stomach, and sleep for 10 days. The service was also prompt, and the gal who walked my order out to my car was super friendly! Prices were very reasonable as well! This experience sure beats out the long line, hasty service, tiny over-priced cups of joe, and hard pastrys, at your local chain Starbucks. They also serve a great variety of craft brews and wines and, have a comfy, dog friendly, patio! I will definitely be back when I am in the area again! Support LOCAL, check this place out, you'll be glad you did!

I really want to love this place but they'll have to step it up for that to happen. For you speed readers, here's the nutshell: GOOD FOOD, pleasant but *very* slow service, smallish but tasty menu, good beer list, okay wine list, awesome dog-friendly patio with a fountain, great music and vibe. Great features on certain nights of the week (see photos). So tonight, my first time here, I came at 6:30 in the evening, in time for a gorgeous AZ sunset on their awesome little [less than half full] patio, but sadly too late for happy hour. Next time... First and foremost, service was so so so slow. I've been in the industry for twenty years, as a server and manager at places from Chili's to Chelsea's to Mary Elaine's so I totally know and consider all the little cogs moving inside a restaurant "machine" during service. I even took into consideration that I was alone, thus more sensitive to the passing of time. My server was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu, but he simply needed more support. From what I could tell, he had the twelve table patio all by himself with only one other gentleman bussing and refilling waters. That is simply too much to balance in order to give proper service (but remember I mentioned it was less than half full when I arrived...? No good reason for such slow service). That being said, the food was very fresh and tasty, and worth the prices. I got the daily lavosh pizza and it was TO DIE FOR. Crispy prosciutto, almond slices, diced apples, mozzarella, and arugula. Wow. They have a nice beer list, a few fun craft cocktails, and an okay wine list, which needs to be updated. I ordered a bottle (1/2 off bottles on Monday -- yes please!), but twenty five minutes later when it finally arrived (yes, 25 min, I actually clocked it.. my hummus app arrived first, which was 23 min after ordering) it was a completely different bottle than listed on the menu. I actually only noticed bc the vintage was different. Nbd as by that point I just wanted a flipping glass of wine already and it was actually quite good. 
Inside is super cute and I can tell they have good decorating sense though it needs some sprucing up (new paint, at least in the restroom). *Love* all the plants hanging around. Overall it's a quaint little local spot, but I'll just keep it in the back of my mind that I should come here expecting service to be slow. That way maybe I'll be impressed if it's better next time.

I'm a huge espresso coffee drinker and their "Nutella Mocha" is, by far, my favorite espresso drink in the Phoenix Metro. Plus, it's the cheapest around way below Starbucks' outrageous prices!
A highly recommended place with a nicely decorated patio and very friendly service.

I really liked this place but the last three times I've come here the price of my beverage has changed each time.  I always order a breve with baileys and it's gone from around $5 to over $10 this time.  Over $10 for a coffee with baileys is insane especially when you sell mimosas and bloody Mary's for $5!  The most expensive coffee drink is $4.75, just don't get it.  I've been here 3 times and come out of my way to go to this place.  Sadly this will be my last time here.

Lovely place with a friendly, easy going and prompt staff.   My friend lives in the area and assumed it's just a coffee shop so the "is she serious?" look she had as she walked up was priceless.  The moscow mule I had was perfect and the bruschetta was very tasty.    Will definitely return for more, am very curious to try the nutella mocha.

Our fave neighborhood hangout. Hike the preserve daily and often end the morning with coffee and a breakfast burrito (large enough to split).  Dog friendly patio works for us. Nighttime is relaxing, food and atmosphere great. We love being here.

I love this little place! They have amazing sandwiches and salads. My personal favorites are the roast beef sandwich, chopped salad, and passion fruit iced tea.  The atmosphere is great with a nice little outdoor patio for a beautiful day, which we have many of in AZ! If you're in the area you must check it out for lunch!

It's not the size that matters when it comes to food . 32 Shea will knock your socks off. Fresh ingredients but together in innovative ways . The salads and baked goods are amazing . I had a peach and rosemary muffin this morning and omg was it ever amazing . I will be back for a cocktail or two ... I hope !

32 Shea is my go-to place for coffee, lunch and happy hour. I work nearby and stop by a few times a week. It's such a cute place. The decor is fabulous and the patio is delightful. Such a great place to hang out with a glass of wine.


 The coffee is excellent and I've never had any issues in the drive-thru. I've tried a few of their limited/ seasonal lattes and they've all been great. The lunch menu is excellent- the salads and sandwiches are incredible. Try the tuna and the omg.

I've never had any issues with long wait times. In fact, I'm amazed at how quickly they get food out- the kitchen is miniscule.
Cute spot.  Actually exactly what I was looking for, a coffee shop that wasn't a Starbucks.  Enjoyed the lavender latte and steel cut oatmeal with fruit.  Small, but yummy.  Will be back.

Stop in for a bite pretty good made fresh the people were friendly and nice ambiance they have a nice patio area to sit in outside. 
The only draw back is the outside patio has several spots without shade.

What a great transformation this establishment has made and brought to this shopping center!

I'll always remember the original building and how 32 Shea looked when it first opened. It is now extremely unique, beautiful iron fencing, the landscape has grown in so well; the patio area just looks phenomenal! The young woman who had the dream of opening this place should be very proud!  

I ordered the Juicy Roast Beef & it's unbelievable! I highly recommend! The horseradish is not overpowering and the cool tomatoes are a nice pairing with the warm roast beef... Love!!!

This place is elite. With very small square footage Café 32 delivers the most satisfaction per square foot of retail space as any place I've seen in Phoenix. The lovely owner takes great pride in her café and it shows. The lovely female baristas are very polite and so are the male baristas. The seating inside can be cramped but not bad, outside seating is very nice.

I had lunch there today and my sandwich was exceptional ( roast beef).

I will try dinner after I find a nice GF.

So, if you like good espresso made the right way, Café 32 is it.

We went to this place several years ago and stopped for some reason I really don't remember why. So we discovered it again and loved the atmosphere so we stayed coming back, had good food and friendly staff the first two times we came but not today not even close. We sat close to 30 minutes after we ordered waiting for our food, people were showing up ordering and getting their food and we still weren't getting our order. (A burrito we were splitting) After I was thoroughly annoyed my wife went in and asked, bla, bla, bla they'd have it out as soon as they could a few minutes later we got an over nuked disgusting chunk we couldn't even eat after a good try though we left what was left of what some third world country folk would maybe accept on the table and walked out. Perhaps this is why we stopped coming before. Maybe in a few years when I forget this terrible experience I'll try it again .
Cute little restaurant/ coffee house, food was delicious, staff was super friendly. We happened to be in the area and noticed it was an unexpected surprise. We will be back!

If you are someone that is interested in immediate service and subpar coffee then 32 Shea isn't the place for you. 32 Shea has a little bit of a wait but it's more than worth it! I have yet to have a cup of coffee that was anything but exceptional. My only qualm with the place is that it's pretty small and crowded on the inside, but they have an outdoor patio that is quite accommodating. So if you have the opportunity to stop by here in the early afternoon that's the time I would suggest!
